section.title: Microsoft Windows Server
section.para: Four scripts, located in the Services\bin\windows folder, install and uninstall the recovery manager and transaction server services.

note.para: Each of the scripts requires administrative privileges.

section.para: After running any of the scripts, a status message indicates success or failure.

step.title: Log into the system with root privileges.
step.para: The installer needs these privileges to create files in /etc.

step.title: Change to JBOSS_HOME/services/installer directory.
step.para: JBOSS_HOME refers to the directory where you extracted ArjunaTA.

step.title: Set the JAVA_HOME variable, if necessary.
step.para: Set the JAVA_HOME variable to the base directory of the JVM the service will use. The base directory is the directory above bin/java.

step.title: The start-up and shut-down scripts are installed.
step.para: Information similar to the output below is displayed.

step.para: The start-up and shut-down scripts are installed for each run-level. Depending on your specific operating system, you may need to explicitly enable the services for automatic start-up.

step.title: Log into the system with root privileges.
step.para: The installer needs these privileges to delete files in /etc.

step.title: Change to JBOSS_HOME/services/installer directory.
step.para: JBOSS_HOME refers to the directory where you extracted ArjunaTA.

step.title: Run the installation script with the -u option.
The start-up and shut-down scripts are removed.
step.para: Messages like the ones below indicate that the start-up and shut-down scripts have been removed successfully.
